title: Can I learn math online? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s certainly possible (sites like Khan Academy wouldn’t be a bad start), but it will be much more difficult. The general problem with online learning is the lack of interaction with an instructor, and the instructors inability to adjust the material or explanation for the student. I’ve taken a staggering number of math courses in my life, and yes many of them I probably could have managed in an online format. But there’s that one concept, that one trick, that you need to grasp but can’t quite manage to get your mental hands around. Until you talk it out with the professor, they might point out a fundamental error you’re making (multiplication isn’t necessarily commutative for groups) or an alternate way of viewing something (real-valued polynomials will follow one of two patterns as the tend towards both infinities).
